Last year, we just went to the nursery and bought some plants and planted them in the garden. And this year, Holly said, I'm going to start with seeds. Why did she do that? Well, she expected something to happen. She didn't do it because she was bored and she had nothing else to do. She had an expectation. And guess what we were talking yesterday? She said, do you see all the flowers on the plants outside? One day soon, I'm going to eat a tomato sandwich with a tomato from my garden. Why? Because there was an expectation that something was going to happen when that seed was put in that soil, in the sunlight, with water. That growth would take place. That fruit would be produced.
